channel.title: Windows can't check for updates
channel.description:
I have 8 updates waiting for my laptop and then when i try to install them it says:
Some updates were not installed
code 80244019
I have searched everywhere for a solution and i can not find one.
please can anyone provide me a solution :frowning:

item.title: Windows can't check for updates
item.dc:creator: chipstix4
item.description:
Metritutus:

I hate all the ‘suggestions’ that no updates are a good thing. For all its faults, the windows updates do generally fix security holes etcetera, and are not a bad thing in my opinion.

Anyway, Windows update can have issues. I know I had some with my laptop. When it says eight updates are waiting, have you got it set to download them and then notify you that it can install them, or are they not yet downloaded? That should narrow down to whether it is a connection problem or not, I think.

I have the option set to “install updates automatically”

Read full topic

item.title: Windows can't check for updates
item.dc:creator: chipstix4
item.description:
Imonfire:

IIRC 80244019 means there’s a connection problem with the server. Is the problem recent?

No this problem has been going for a while with the same updates for

microsoft.net framework 3.5
cumulative update for media centre
updates for windows junk mail filter
realtek - network - realtek RTL8…
realtek semi-conductor corp
microsoft SQL server

Read full topic

item.title: Windows can't check for updates
item.dc:creator: chipstix4
item.description:
Jokerine:

If you’re trying to update Internet Explorer 8, I hear, in certain cases, there’s a problem that keeps your system from updating/uninstalling it.

i use Firefox and i only have Windows internet explorer 7

Read full topic

I hate all the ‘suggestions’ that no updates are a good thing. For all its faults, the windows updates do generally fix security holes etcetera, and are not a bad thing in my opinion.

Anyway, Windows update can have issues. I know I had some with my laptop.
